text:
I just picked up Apache 2.0.43 to run a test environment locally on my Windows
98 SE machine.  I use PHP 4 and MySQL with the server.

The server starts just fine by typing at the command prompt, "apache".  However,
I can never shut it down.  I tried stopping (apache -k stop) and uninstalling
(apache -k uninstall), but no effect.  Also the Apache console doesn't do
anything either beyond displaying the active server service.  I even tried
shutting it down by using Window's Task Manager (alt-control-delete), but still
couldn't shut down (never seen a program that can stay around this persistantly).

The only way so far that I could shut down the server is by rebooting.  Even
then, Windows pop up several dialog boxes to tell me that I need to shut down
Apache before closing Windows.  I can eventually shut it down then.
creator: mgy333@hotmail.com

text:
I see the same with Apache 2.0.43 on Win98SE (no PHP installed yet).
Installing/uninstalling as a service works, starting the service from de
commandline or at system start works.  Stopping or restarting the service
doesn't work.

The "Apache Monitor" application shows "running status" correct, but
start/stop/restart buttons don't work.

When I use Adamant Procmon from http://adamant.n3.net/ it shows a hidden 2nd
apache proces.  The only way I can shutdown apache is by killing *both*
processes with Procmon.  (The hidden extra process is the reason why the
standard Windows Task Manager can't kill the program.)
creator: apache@janc.cjb.net

text:
1. this is only a bug on Windows 9x, not on Windows NT (afaik)
2. it still exists in version 2.0.44
3. it has nothing to do with firewalls
==> this bug is not fixed

I tested v2.0.44 (with Win9x patch installed) on Win98SE with and without a
firewall (Kerio PF).

BTW: the Apache Monitor application that comes with Apache 2 works fine with
Apache 1.3.27 (even with a firewall), it doesn't work with Apache 2 (on Win9x).

[off-topic]Why not include Apache Monitor with Apache 1.3.x?[/off-topic]

text:
I also can shutdown and uninstall the apache service with Apache 2.0.46 in 
Win98 SE. I stop running this service by typing "msconfig" at Run and uncheck 
the service from the Startup tab.

Now, I start up the service manually, but stop it by reboot.

I have the same problems...
Used the Windows installer (MSIEXEC version 2.00.2600.2) with the file 
apache_2.0.49-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi.  This added the following registry entry...
"Apache2"="\"C:\\PROGRAM FILES\\APACHE GROUP\\APACHE2\\BIN\\APACHE.EXE\" -n 
Apache2 -k runservice"
to the registry key...
[HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\RunServices]

// Off  Topic: The computer 266 Mhz PII appeared to lock up (actually,
// running dead slow) on reboot.  The configuration file MUST be modified
// for Win98 so that it uses...  Win32DisableAcceptEx

As far as starting/stopping the "service"...
1 - The Apache Service Monitor doesn't appear to communicate with the service, 
either to start it or stop it.

2 - The service doesn't seem to respond correctly to the Windows shutdown 
(internal) message - possibly Windows 98SE does not provide enough time on a 
slow PC.  The Windows dialog appears (titled: APACHE) stating "You must quit 
this program before you quit Windows."

3 - The service seems to actually shutdown OK if the user clicks "cancel", and 
then tries AGAIN to shutdown Windows.

4 - The command installed in the Start Menu works to start the service, with...
"C:\Program Files\Apache Group\Apache2\bin\Apache.exe" -w -n "Apache2" -k start
